decision_conditions: Reason : 1 - The applicant has failed to provide a clear and accurate description of the proposed development. In particular, the eaves height and maximum height of the extension as described on the submitted application form conflict with the dimensions shown on the submitted plans. This application therefore fails to comply with Schedule 2, Part 1, Class A, condition A.4 (1)(2)(a) of the Town & Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).

Reason : 2 - The first floor window and changes to the roof cannot be considered under an application to determine if prior approval is required for a proposed: Larger home extension. The development therefore does not comply with the conditions, limitations of restrictions permitted by Class A which exceeds the limits in paragraph A.1(f) but is allowed by paragraph A.1(g), Schedule 2, Part 1, Class A of the Town & Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015.

Reason : 3 - INFORMATIVE 2 - Refused Drawings

BLOCK PLAN; REAR WITH EXTENSION; SIDE WITH EXTENSION; BIRDS EYE VIEW WITH EXTENSION

Reason : 4 - INFORMATIVE 1 - Note to Applicant
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton  (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:
"	Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
"	Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
"	As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.
In this instance:
"	The application was not considered to comply with the provisions of the General Permitted Development Order 2015 (as amended)
"	It is noted that the applicant/agent did not engage in any pre-application discussions.
